title: 22 ski resorts in Japan are now offering free lift tickets to foreigners
text:
22 ski resorts in Japan are now offering free lift tickets to foreigners 
February 02, 2017 
As reported by Japan’s Rocket News 24 , 22 resorts in the Fukushima prefecture are giving away free lift tickets to young foreigners (ages 19-24) in an attempt to introduce them to some of the country’s lesser-known ski areas. With free lift tickets, you can’t afford not to ski Japan. Photo: Courtesy of Visit Fukushima 
While resorts in Japan’s northernmost prefecture of Hokkaido are quickly becoming world-renowned for their staggering snow totals , resorts in Japan’s south island of Honshu don’t get the same exposure as their northern counterparts. 
In an effort to change that, Visit Fukushima — the prefecture’s tourism board — developed the promotion . The mountains are less than two hours away from Tokyo, perfect for anyone who wants to experience Japanese powder and city culture. Photo: Courtesy of Moyan Brenn/ Flickr 
The terms of the promotion are simple: If you’re between the ages of 19-24, you can visit any of the 22 resorts in the Aizu or Minami Aizu areas of Fukushima until March 31. Simply show your passport at the ticket window, and get a free day of skiing. 
And, if you happen to be outside of that age range don’t worry — the promotion is also offering discounted lift tickets for roughly $17 USD for anyone that doesn’t fall within the 19-24 age range. 
With the mountains of Fukushima only 80 minutes from the bustling streets of Tokyo by bullet train, the offer is a great opportunity for any travelers who want to get a couple turns in while still experiencing the big city culture.
